TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit TermSetItem extends Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.TaxonomyItem
Public MustInherit Class TermSetItem Inherits TaxonomyItem

Docs.summary: Provides an abstraction of the object that is a parent of objects.

remarks.para: TermSetItem is an abstract class and must be overridden. It contains references to the parts that define a TaxonomyItem (e.g., Name, Id, etc). It also contains a collection of child Term objects and provides interface to retrieve or update the child Term objects. If the TermSetItem is an Orphan or Keyword, it must not have any children.

Each TermSetItem has a user associated with it as the owner. It has a flag indicating if it can be used in the tagging UI. It also has a CustomSortOrder field defines the sort order of the child Terms.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.Term CreateTerm (string name, int lcid);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.Term CreateTerm(string name, int32 lcid) cil managed
Public Function CreateTerm (name As String, lcid As Integer) As Term
public: Microsoft::SharePoint::Taxonomy::Term ^ CreateTerm(System::String ^ name, int lcid);

Docs.param: LCID to create the label on
Docs.summary: Creates a new below this instance.The name is the default Label for the LCID specified.

remarks.para: If the object for this is not an open TermSet then the current user must have EditTerm permissions in order to use this method.

If the specified lcid is not the default language of the , a with the name and the default language of the TermStore will also be created to ensure the Term has a default Label for the default language of the TermStore.
If the current TermSetItem is the Keyword Term Set, then label is always created for the term store default language.

The value will be normailized to trim consecutive spaces into one and replace the & character with the wide character version of the character (\uFF06). The leading and trailing spaces will be trimmed. It must be non-empty and cannot exceed 255 characters, and cannot contain any of the following characters ; "<>|&tab.
The current user will be set as the owner of the new Term.

Docs.exception: The user does not have sufficient permission to perform this operation.
Keyword term set only allows a flat list of Terms.
The name is not valid, it contains invalid characters or is too long.
The name is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or empty string.

Docs.param: LCID to create the label on
Docs.summary: Creates a new object below this Microsoft.SharePoint.TaxonomyItem object.The name is the default for the specified LCID.

remarks.para: If the specified LCID is not the default language of the TermStore, a Label with the name and the default language of the TermStore will also be created to ensure the Term has a default Label for the default language of the TermStore.
If the current is the Keyword Term Set, then label is always created for the term store default language.

The value will be normailized to trim consecutive spaces into one and replace the & character with the wide character version of the character (\uFF06). The leading and trailing spaces will be trimmed. It must be non-empty and cannot exceed 255 characters, and cannot contain any of the following characters ;"<>|&tab
The current user will be set as the owner of the new Term.
If the already exists in the TermStore, an exception will be thrown.
If the TermSet for this is not an open TermSet then the current user must have TaxonomyRights.EditTerm permission to use this method. must be called to save this change to the database.

Docs.exception: The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation.
Keyword term set only allows a flat list of Terms.
The name is not valid, it contains invalid characters, or is too long.
The name is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or empty string.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.TermCollection GetTerms (int pagingLimit);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.TermCollection GetTerms(int32 pagingLimit) cil managed
Public Function GetTerms (pagingLimit As Integer) As TermCollection
public: Microsoft::SharePoint::Taxonomy::TermCollection ^ GetTerms(int pagingLimit);

Docs.param: The maxium number of items to return in the collection
Docs.summary: Gets a paged collection containing the child objects of this object
Docs.returns: A paged collection containing the child Term instances of this TermSetItem

remarks.para: This method has the same results as except that it returns a collection that supports paging.
Call the method before using a paged collection. The paged collection does not reflect uncommited changes if the collection size is greater than the pagingLimit.
The returned term collection is sorted based on the custom sort order. If there is no custom sort order defined, then it is sorted based on alphabetic order of the . property values.

Docs.exception: The paging limit must be greater than zero.

Docs.param: The source Term for the reused Term
Reuse the and its child Terms
Docs.summary: Creates a new reused object below this object based on a .

remarks.para: Reuse a term from a different term set to become a child of the current TermSetItem. The target term set cannot be the Keyword or Orphaned Term Set. Keywords cannot be reused.
The current user must have TaxonomyRights.EditTerm permission in order to use this method. must be called in order to save this change to the database.

Docs.exception: The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation.
This operation is invalid in the Orphaned Terms term set.The operation failed.
The source Term is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) or invalid

Docs.summary: Creates a new below a instance based on a and makes the Term pinned so that only the local custom properties, , and custom sort order for the can be changed in the TermSet object.

remarks.para: This method cannot be called on an orphaned term set or hash tag term set.

Docs.exception: The current user has insufficient permissions to perform this operation. The user needs to have the permission.
